description: Borrowed from Spanish salsa (“sauce”), from Latin salsus (“salted”), whence also the doublet sauce (via Old French).

entries.meaning: (countable) A spicy tomato sauce, often including onions and hot peppers.
(uncountable, music) A style of urban music originally from New York heavily influenced by Cuban dance music, jazz and rock.
(countable, dance) Any of several dances performed to salsa music.

verbs.description: salsa (third-person singular simple present salsas, present participle salsaing, simple past and past participle salsaed)

examples: They salsaed late until the night.
